sentences: Marshall Barer (born Marshall Louis Barer; February 19, 1923 in Astoria, Queens â€“ August 25, 1998 in Santa Fe, New Mexico) was a lyricist, librettist, singer, songwriter and director.
Barer began his career as a lyricist and songwriter in the late 1940s while working as a commercial artist/designer in New York.
In 1972 he wrote 7 songs for Scarecrow in a Garden of Cucumbers a low-budget movie starring Holly Woodlawn.
Marshall died aged 75 in Santa Fe, New Mexico, at his home, after living many years in Venice, California.
Around the World in Eighty Days with music by Michel Legrand
